intro: Minuartia tchihatchewii, commonly known as the Armenian rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats on rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy stems. Native to the Caucasus region, it is often found in alpine and arid environments.
